description: Alteration of Spanish vamos (“we go”) or vámonos (“let's go”). Cognate with English namous.

verbs.description: vamoose (third-person singular simple present vamooses, present participle vamoosing, simple past and past participle vamoosed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, slang) To run away (from); to flee.
examples: Speaking of the room in which I locked McIndoe — I will preface by saying that Mac "vamoosed that ranch" that very day and left me alone.
